website_summaries.verdict: Sleek, sporty bag keeps treats well organized while providing plenty of extra storage.
pros: Divided inner pouch keeps treats separated from each other
Hinged opening stays open when you want and closes easily
Modern design is easy to wear
Spacious front pocket is perfect for holding keys or phones
cons: Large bag can get heavy quickly

customer_reviews.title: Very nice item to have during training
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item to have during training. The rear clip failed early but was able to rig a new one with a coat hanger shown in picture. More sturdy but less tight. Hinge failed and dropped a metal piece into the treat back that I could have easily fed to puppy had I not happened to notice it when reaching for treats.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A tip to keep the hinges working
customer_reviews.text: These wear out. All treat bags wear out. If you use them day-in and day-out, you need to plan to replace your working bag every 4-6 months. This is my experience, based on 10 years of serious training with Border Collies, at least two hours a day. If you want the hinges to last longer, put vaseline, or a little vegetable oil, on them once a week--this keeps the bag opening and closing smoothly and helps the hinges last. But you will still need to buy a new one every six months or so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant design, holds EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: My new rescue dog needed some MEGA help learning to walk on a leash, living indoors, and learning to listen and had ZERO self control. This bag is what I wore for months while he learned his basic commands. I had poop bags, chapstick, house key, clicker, dry treats, and wet treats in this bag. TIP: Use a small ziplock bag inside the large pocket for wet snacks like deli meat and cheese. It prevents the bag from getting wet and gross. Also: end runs from your grocery store deli counter can be diced up into teeny crumbles fro training and are a MUCH safer choice than prepackaged treats. Salami and cheese are my dogs currency.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much we bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This made puppy training so much easier! It attaches nicely to a belt (or you can use the belt strap that comes with it) leaving your hands free to manage the leash and work on hand signals. The metal frame at the top expands the pouch to make getting access to treats so much easier during training, and the extra front pouch is convenient for storing poo bags or a clicker. We lost our first one and I used a different kind that was smaller and that didn't have the structural support that this one had. Now that we have another puppy and are back in training classes, I ordered a second one of these.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: I sold it and kept the drawstring pouch style
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that it would be nice to have a larger treat bag with a divider but it was a bit too large and the dividers ended up being more work than they were worth. It felt a bit precarious when it was held open with the hinge feature. This might be because my dog is very small and I have to bend over to give him treats - it just felt like the treats could fall out. I didn't keep it and ended up going with a drawstring pouch that is much smaller but feels more stable and secure.
customer_reviews.author: DallasRising

customer_reviews.title: 2 1/2 year life - daily use
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this on my belt or belt-loop for 2 1/2 years, which is probably a fairly expected use. The bag material is still fine, but the mechanical parts are exhausted. First, the plastic clip in the back --- that broke after 1 1/2 years daily use. That could be made better. I switched to using the metal snap ring. After about 9 months the spring in the clip gave out. Over time springs that holds the bag tight and keeps the treats from falling out, have broken on both ends. Time to replace
customer_reviews.author: D. Edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Great design and super sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good things about this pouch. Love the clip option the best but love to have the fanny pack style for when I have pants I can’t snap it to. Love the easy open and stays open! I use the smaller portion to put bags in to carry when we walk for bathroom time too!
customer_reviews.author: NVK

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect it to last forever
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through 3 of these now in the last year. (Last about 3-4 months). The belt clip is usually the first to break, although thankfully it has a strap for around the waist as well. After the belt clip the open and close hinge mechanism seems to give out after a while and will no longer stay closed. Note: we do use it every day for quite a bit of training which may explain why they don’t last quite as long. The only reason we have continued to buy these and have given it 3 stars instead of less is because we haven’t found one we like better.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treat pouch 7 years ago to train my last pup. Loved it. After 2 years of constant use it pooped out but well worth it! After just 2 months with the new bag, the hinge to keep the pouch open broke off. Definitely not worth it anymore. Great concept but very poorly executed. Update: Reduced from 2 starts to 1. One day after writing that review the pouch now doesn't close properly. The part that keeps it together fell apart. I have been using it every day up till now, but it should have survived more than 2 months. Very disappointed in the lack of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Critter

customer_reviews.title: Works well for us.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, stays open if you like, clips around waist or can clip on belt . There is another clip your keys. Front pocket with velco can hold a smart phone or small wallet. It as two elastic loops for maybe a pen on front. Opens easily to access treats and can stay open. There is a small pocket inside, I will use this for a very small blueice pack when the weather is warm. Can be wiped clean with soapy water and easily rinsed. So far it has worked well for us.
customer_reviews.author: lynr

customer_reviews.title: My Trainers favorite pouch for a reason
customer_reviews.text: bought this because my trainer recommended it, Love it! Super easy to clean. The belt is easy to adjust and makes it easier to wear behind my back, Not the most pretty great pouch, but it gets the job done and stays super clean, even with wet treats being kept inside. Easy to clean and wipe out in between sessions
customer_reviews.author: Karli Quintana

customer_reviews.title: Good for large hands, not the most durable.
customer_reviews.text: Love that it opens and closes with a hinge for my fat man hands to access treats. Holds enough for more than one training session, or enough for a good training session with multiple dogs. The clip broke off and unfortunately I don’t like the way it sits with just the belt. Don’t like how treats crumble and die in the corners, wish it were more rounded. Not easy to clean out corners and bottom, again, would be better if it were rounded.
customer_reviews.author: Mia GulanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Plastic belt clip is too weak.  But Petsafe is Great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after the first pouch broke within about 6 months. Thought the brake was just a fluke. Ordered the same again and learned where there is a flaw in the design. The plastic clip is too weak. Opening the pouch with appropriate strength breaks the plastic belt clip. This one lasted 6 weeks. Although I would not recommend this product, Petsafe is GREAT. They processed a replacement in one day (shipping it the same day as requested). So the company is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size, finally!
customer_reviews.text: I have looked for a small, unobtrusive treat bag that doesnt have a drawstring closure for months. I bought this bag in regular size and it finally broke. When I was looking, I saw that it came in mini size also. This one is small, is hinged, easy to close and I don’t feel like I have a suitcase around my waist. I use it for dog agility training and it is perfect. Comes in two sizes...the mini is perfect for me (I am rather small).
customer_reviews.author: LIN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pouch. I can put treats and my cell phone in it. I put my dog poop bags on it, and with the little hook on the side I can tie the full bag of poop there 💩 (well it’s gotta go somewhere right🤷‍♀️). And that option to me is great so I don’t have to carry it in my hands. I would recommend this bag. Also I put my treats in a zip lock plastic bag and then put it in the pouch, so it keeps the inside of the pouch clean.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Just Right for My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pouch. It has two openings. I use the one hinged pocket for a few of handfuls of little nuggets, and the second pocket which closes with Velcro for some extra special treats. The second pocket could also be used for a potty bag, house keys, etc. There are several ways carry this pouch, (belt, and two kinds of hooks) but I find the adjustable, nylon, waist belt very comfortable and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Maplewood Girl

customer_reviews.title: It's not a fanny pack; It's a snack pack!
customer_reviews.text: My sister makes fun of me for wearing this "fanny pack" when I walk my dog. I call it a "snack pack" since I keep dog treats in there. My iPhone 7 fits in it and so do my keys. I also put a magnetic clip on flashlight on it for walking the dog at night. Now I can just grab it and go when its walk time instead of disappointing my dog by going back in the house for treats that I forgot.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha A

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product would sometimes close on its own, and it's so strong that it actually really hurts my hand! See video on how hard to open it, and how little force it takes to close, you can also see how strong it closes. I expect product like this to be easy open and a soft close, this product is very inconvenient when doing dog training. Awful product for me, and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Beware, snaps shut on your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small bait bag with ability to separate different training treats. I was so excited about this product then quickly disappointed when it snapped shut on my fingers multiple times during our walk. I expected the product to stay open as advertised then the slightly bump would close it quickly, often on my fingers while trying to retrieve a treat. I returned the product after a day.
customer_reviews.author: A1

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and durable MINI treat pouch!
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the MINI Treat Pouch. My boyfriend bought the larger one (You can fit a small tennis ball into the larger one) and I thought it was great, but wanted something smaller. Double compartments inside, the snap style on the pocket is a little difficult to open but it will loosen with use. Comes with a belt to use it with but I don't personally use that. I attached my clicker to the elastic band on the outside. Also has a clip on the end, I attached potty bags to that. 5/5 would recommend to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Gage

customer_reviews.title: Works great but is a bit bigger than I should have ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in a obedience class with my westie. Works great but is a bit bigger than I should have gotten. The opening is big enough for getting treats out and there is also a pocket for poop bags. It closes up tight to keep the treats in and the dog out. I do put my treats in a plastic bag to keep it clean and that causes me to slow down in my treating however. That is no fault on the bags part. I’ve been happy with my purchase so far!
customer_reviews.author: Mommaeagle

customer_reviews.title: Great little Treat Bag.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased February 20, 2018. I had read some reviews about the Hinges. I lubed them with a little touch of Air safe Silicon ( used by scuba divers and medical supplies ) and have not had a bit of problems with it. Use it multiple times ever day for my Mini Aussie. Have washed it twice. The thing I like most is I can clip in on my jeans pocket and at least the 4 times he has pawed it off it closed itself so he learned that did not get him the food. Also a hint I use plastic snack bags for my moist treats to protect the pouch they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Wilstyx

customer_reviews.title: Ok but a little awkward
customer_reviews.text: It sits nice on my hip and is comfortable and well made. However, I was hoping it was more of a pocket. It's not. There's a metal piece on the top that pops it open and it stays open, so you have two choices: pop it open and it sticks out kinda like a cup so you bend over and everything falls out, or it's closed and very tough to get your hand in there to grab a training treat. Meh. Ok for intense training sessions but not practical for using all day.
customer_reviews.author: tourdm

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy-duty pouch with sturdy attachments; somewhat weak elastic loops but otherwise excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice heavy pouch with multiple methods of attachment and a couple of pockets. I use it every day when walking/training my dogs. The one small complaint is that the 2 loops for the rolls of doggie poo bags tend to stretch out rather quickly compared to the long-lasting fabrics used in the rest of the bag. I started losing bag rolls after a few months, so have starting stashing them in the back pocket. Not much of a problem for me, but if I were counting on the elastic loops I'd be disturbed.
customer_reviews.author: P. Yeargin

customer_reviews.title: Treat pouch for training
customer_reviews.text: Working with my Akita pup, I ordered the large bag. This bag is great quality. It has an inside pocket to maybe put a phone and keep it away from getting dirty. The metal brace that holds the pouch open is such a great idea. When done you can press closed with ease and treats will not fall out. Had a belt clip or waist option that is generous and durable. Large pouch can hold a few treats and a tennis ball no problem. It will not close if you chose to put a tennis ball in the bag. I train about 3-4 hours daily. Great pouch and great price. Even if this happened to break I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: R L G

customer_reviews.title: Gave out after a year
customer_reviews.text: The design in nice. Has the treat pouch with the hinged opening and a separate pocket for whatever. I put my clicker in it. But over tme, the hinges have become very stiff, and will not open/close properly. I drop treats on the floor because it won't stay shut. Also, it won't stay open long enough for me to extricate the treats. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Ranney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for me. I'm about 5'4" with small hands, so it works great. I've recently been trying to do click training with my dog, so this frees up my hands so I can treat and click, as needed. It's so much easier than trying to reach into a baggie in my pocket when the reward needs to come quickly with/after the click. The hinge works great at keeping the treats accessible while open and in the pouch while closed! My boyfriend ended up the larger one for him to use with his dog, too.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Z.

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for dog training!!
customer_reviews.text: Wear it on the belt and keep it on while you’re home. I put it on my side partly around the back to keep tiny kibble treats handy and out of my dog’s reach. The closure snaps open and shut with two metal bands like those little change purses that you pinch open. The key to training is repetition, consistency and patience and this pouch is invaluable to facilitate training. It doesn’t work to give a dog a cue then have to go get a treat for him. So all the time you’re around the dog you can reinforce what he’s learning.
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great pouch for dog training! It easily clips into your pants/belt to leave both hands free. The opening can snap open to make it easy to get out treats. There is also a hook to clip it onto your belt loop. Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: So good we bought another!
customer_reviews.text: Our first was stolen (who steals a dog treat pouch?! I'm sure they were very disappointed in the contents...), so we immediately reordered this. It's great for both myself and my husband to wear (band is easily adjustable) and it is sturdy, but easy to access on runs, walks, etc. The mechanism with which it snaps open/closed is high quality and easy to operate single-handedly (literally).
customer_reviews.author: Lily Engle

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this does not get 5 stars is because the divider that allows you to keep two separate types of treats (high value/lower value) is very short. It is less than half the height of the overall pocket meaning you cannot put as many treats in as it appears to hold. When you are actively training, especially if working with more than one dog, you may find yourself running out of treats because of this. Other than that, the construction is great, and I love the included belt and hinged top.
customer_reviews.author: C Fritsche

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen and bought several great bags - this one is by far the most functional. It is a good size in the main bag and has a small divider. I carry a roll of poop bags and 2 zip lock bags of treats in it. I can clip it to my pants, there is a strap to put it around my waist and a carabiner to hook it onto a belt loop. Best feature is that the bag stays open on its own. I have 2-3 dogs with me usually and this bag gives me full and easy access!
customer_reviews.author: Kathrin Gerstel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dog training and taking your dog for walks!
customer_reviews.text: Recently took my dog in for obedience training. Initially, I just used the bag that the training treats came in, but this thing has been amazing. A few months after the training was complete, and I still use this. It's extremely convenient to bring with during those sessions as well as strapping on for your daily walk around the park with your dog. I haven't had any issues with the latch breaking since I don't see the need for opening and closing it that often. If anything, I've heard of people putting olive oil or some other kind of oil on the hinges to make them last longer.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone training a dog, this is a must have! My puppy snaps to attention when I put this on and is ready to work. She loves her training and treats and this pouch has spring-loaded hinges that holds it open (think Grandma's handbag) when training for easy access, but when closed it keeps even high moisture treats fresh. This pouch could be useful well beyond animal training, as it is well-made, sturdy and attractive. The price is fabulous, as well. I've shared this great find with my Kennel Club group and everybody wears them now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke too quick
customer_reviews.text: I had a pouch exactly like this and the metal in the mouth of the pouch broke after years of use. After the return time period with this product expired, just outside of a month after purchase, the metal in this pouch broke. I was stuck with a broken product, which is very disappointing. The cloth material is a good quality but the metal didn’t hold up and the pouch couldn’t close after that. Had to toss the product and look for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Asa Rae

customer_reviews.title: Device to hold it open broke in 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: The dual pouches mean that each are pretty small, but good enough for what we would need and we expected as much when we ordered. The real issue is that the mechanism that's supposed to hold it open broke only 5 months after having it. This means not only doesn't it stay open for you, but it actually tries to keep it closed which makes it even more difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: KJ Utah

customer_reviews.title: Best Treat Pouch Available
customer_reviews.text: I tried SO MANY treat pouches but none are close this this. Good amount of space, easy to quickly retrieve treats! Only downfall is that I've tossed this in my bag and had treats fall out but thats a user error
customer_reviews.author: Francine Darling

customer_reviews.title: Very useful-recommend to friends
customer_reviews.text: Good pouch. Gets tons of use. I’ve heard things about the hinges but I’ve used mine for a year or so with a service dog in training as walking/training other dogs and it is great still. I recommend this bag to clients. Inexpensive and better for novices who spill dog treats out of packs that stay open when you lean down.
customer_reviews.author: londonmumof3inCT

customer_reviews.title: Make dog training easier!
customer_reviews.text: As a Certified Professional Dog Trainer I use this product everyday. It’s very durable and has some great features including a pouch that stays open as needed. Adjustable belt makes fit comfortable. You can also clip to pants instead. MUST HAVE for dog trainers and students alike. Best pouch on the market!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Metal clasp on pouch protrudes and pokes.
customer_reviews.text: Pouch is decent size, and the material is solid. However, one of metal clasps that closes pouch has a sharp point that sticks me constantly. This same clasp has ripped through the material on the side. I am needing to replace this pouch (with a different brand/model) after using it for less than a month. I would not recommend this pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Dtouan

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This accessory makes training your dog easier. Helps keep element of surprise as to where the treat will come from ( you switch between right and left hand)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good design.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with the product. Hard to keep the bag open to reach treats, it snaps shut all the time. When it does close it’s a PITA to get open while you are holding a leash and trying to do training. If you use just the belt clip and bend over, it pops off your belt and spreads treats everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed- difficult for me to get in & out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a treat pouch that I could fit my hand into, grab treat and exit very quickly like I see trainers do. It might be because I bought the smaller pouch but I struggle to get it open, put enough of my hand into and retrieve a treat. No use for me- a fanny pack seems to work better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cristine K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality considering functionality cons below
customer_reviews.text: Purchased: mini black Pros: Fits about a cup Stays closed when running Bag can detach from belt Hoops to hook on a doggie bag Cons: Tough to open! I need 2 hands. Meant for smaller hands Clip doesn't hold on to clothes sturdy enough to run. Would need the belt loop or a sturdier clasp with alligator teeth. You cannot stick anything hard in the front pocket because then the bag won't open. I tried to put my phone in the front pocket and it fit but then I couldn't get out the kibble. (Did not dock score because of this though as I don't feel a phone pocket was the intended purpose)
customer_reviews.author: Kim K

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (& am going to buy another) for a hands free leash. They have hands free leashes that come with pouches, etc.... But the reviews for them were horrible. This pouch has two pockets, it comes with a holder to put on your waist but we didn't need it. I attached this to our hands free leash and it works perfectly. It has an attachment for that purpose. So yes, exactly what we needed and it's very good quality just like the hands free leash we ordered that did not come with cheap-o pouches, belt and leash! 10/10!!!
customer_reviews.author: WifeandHubby

customer_reviews.title: Useful treat carrier
customer_reviews.text: Nice treat pouch, large enough for a training session or walk yet small enough not to stand out awkwardly. It snaps shut very securely and quite hard, so watch those fingers! I can't attest to the durability yet but it seems well made. My only complaint is that the pouch is difficult to open one handed, a small pull tab attached to the main pocket would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pouch that opened like this but this one is almost impossible to open with one hand. And, as I usually have a leash in the other hand, that's problematic. I'm hoping the metal parts will loosen up, otherwise I would send it back. Also, there is a pull tab for one of the front pockets, but none for the main section making it even harder to open if you are not looking at it. It is bigger than I would like but that's my fault for not paying more attention to the listed size.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra investment
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to spend the money on this treat pouch but I'm glad I did. With its easy open/close top I can grab a treat and secure it from any bold "treat snatchers" with very little fiddling. The pockets are useful for low-value treats, whistles, extra clickers, etc, and it's easy to ckip a clicker onto the outside hook for easy access. Glad I bought it, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Goat

customer_reviews.title: and a ziploc bag for treats was not a good solution. After looking at several models
customer_reviews.text: I bought this treat bag for my partner who has a service dog. O goes everywhere with them, and a ziploc bag for treats was not a good solution. After looking at several models, this product was purchased. The main reason is that, unlike other pouches which have a round base, this treat pouch was relatively flat. it could more easily into a messenger type bag. Originally I had been very skeptical of the metal closure. But after using this treat bag I am a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: It's totally fine for a small pouch.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something small and this was it, but after using it I don't love the opening system. I've also found that with any of these bags I tend to put the treats in a baggie first otherwise they go stale and hard very quickly (since I use soft style treats). That being said, it did exactly what it advertised. I should have chosen more wisely if I wanted to stick anything other than treats in it.
customer_reviews.author: JLCVT

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic Quality - Broken after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Both hinges broke after 3 months - use was a daily walk, not abused or treated poorly. The metal hinges fractured and came out in the dog's food - fortunately, we were able to get the metal bits out of my dog's mouth before he swallowed. I contacted PetSafe & they didn't reply - and it's been 6 weeks. Pathetic quality and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Guide

customer_reviews.title: It's smaller now!
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these bags, and have probably bough 8 or 10 of them over the years as I am a dog trainer. All of sudden, this new bag arrives at least a full inch or more smaller than the old bags used to be. Treats don't fit as well,, the metal clasp doesn't stay open as nicely, and it's definitely a bit of disappointment. :-(
customer_reviews.author: AGirlNamedTBone

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a product! I can have every thing for a walk with my dog in one place. Can be put in dishwasher. I carry pouch in my hand no more searching in coat pockets. Comes with belt not made for thick waisted people. I can just get it clipped. Has sturdy clip on back. Watch your fingers hing on pouch strong and quick to close.
customer_reviews.author: Deb w

customer_reviews.title: BEST treat pouch EVERRRRRRRRR
customer_reviews.text: Definitely my favorite treat pouch. I work with dogs 5-6 days a week so I rely heavily on this equipment. Beats out everything else EASILY on account of the hinge system it employs to open and shut the main pounch. The multiple compartments inside the pouch itself allows you to carry various values with you at all times as well. The clips and loops make carrying around a roll of poop bags easy and this thing has stood the test of time in so far as durability. This is my second one so I can have one for home and one for work.
customer_reviews.author: leeron

customer_reviews.title: This one works
customer_reviews.text: Finally a training pouch that works. Food doesn't spill out. It's easy to open with one hand and also snaps closed. With the belt, I can move it from my right to my left side on the fly. It holds treats and a tennis ball. I probably will be ordering more for family to use while training their dogs. Just wish it came in more colors so we don't mix up which one goes with what dog. So far now cleaning problems and it seems sturdy,but I've only had it a few weeks. It is used daily. I will be happy to raise my rating once I've had it long enough to determine durability and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, closing feature is what I like
customer_reviews.text: The belt and belt clip are ok nothing fancy which is acceptable, my wife made fun of me for getting this but my pups like it and it’s better than having treats crumble in my pockets. Material seems durable and easy enough to clean out. I like the spring closure vs a cinch string type bag
customer_reviews.author: I buy too much stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Dog's Life!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I admit that I thought having one of these pouches in obedience class would look pretentious. But, I have come to rely on it completely! I take it on dog walks, to agility, in the yard. The pouch snaps easily shut when you are in agility class and need to close it quickly. There's a side pocket that holds my phone for dog walks, as well as waste bags, etc. Sturdy material, expandable belt...I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mitchell-Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Faulty pet bag
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered this product and both times the hing broke on the right side! The first one I had for about a year the latest one I purchased in November! It’s too late to return it and it cannot be repaired. Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: deelew

customer_reviews.title: PetSafe treat pouch
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say I'm returning this treat bag. The snap closure is so tight it's very difficult to open, and when it is open if you bend over the treats will fall out. The upsides are, 1. there's a small Carabiner Clip on the side of the treat bag, which is handy for hanging whatever you have that needs to be hung there. 2. the small Velcro pocket in the front can hold a few dollar bills an anything else that's similar.
customer_reviews.author: A Basset is an Asset

customer_reviews.title: Horrible bag- do not risk purchase
customer_reviews.text: When I received this bag it opened very hard. Several others at agility have this bag and they were very surprised at how hard it opened. We had a long break in agility due to instructor traveling to trials and went to prepare for tonight’s class and now the bag won’t close at all! It appears that the hinge has also pushed through the cloth causing a small rip. It is unusable and of course, the return window just closed. Very poor quality bag.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for puppy training
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for puppy training! It’s a snap closure that stays open until you press slightly on the front edge. You can see all the treats at a glance, if you like to use a variety.The belt clip is very convenient. Small compartment keeps spare poop bags.
customer_reviews.author: Tben

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for doggie bags and treats
customer_reviews.text: I use this not only when I walk my dogs but for walking shelter dogs too. The separate compartments are convenient and my cell phone fits perfectly into the larger section. Also has a small carabiner for keys or I use it for my shelter i.d. tag. Had my first one 4 years and only just now had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Taichimamma

customer_reviews.title: Good training pouch
customer_reviews.text: It's a little big and catches the leash while training, especially when teaching how to heel on my left. The pouch will stay open if needed and the jaw mechanism is holding up ok so far but it's only been about 5 weeks since purchasing. Room for my iPhone 6s (without case), keys and poop bags. I've only used the belt around the waist but the attached clip isn't uncomfortable against my waist. The inside treat pouch area is vinyl so easy to wash and has a divider for 2 different treats. Fits my 32" hips with room for expansion.
customer_reviews.author: L Warner

customer_reviews.title: good size to carry phone
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice pouch and the size is great to put your phone in pocket to bring along. The interior pouch is separated by a divider. The pouch is a bit too large if you are using small training bite style treats like Bil-Jack. But overall is a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for our Golden Pyrenees!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Love that the pouch has several pockets for storing different types of treats. We are training our dog to walk on the leash properly, and this treat bag has been a game changer. Training tip—buy Pupperoni for training Treats! It doesn’t make dog’s mouths water as much, and the smell gets them focused.
customer_reviews.author: joyandlady

customer_reviews.title: I like that the hinge will stay open for easy access ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered treat pouch to use during training session & on walks with my dog. I like that the hinge will stay open for easy access during training sessions, but also opens & closes easily. It comes with a belt that easily clips & unclips, but it can be used without the belt, if you so choose. The interior pocket is waterproof & has a divider, so you can set it up to have two different types of treats. Also there is an outside pocket that I use for a few poop bags, should I need them when we're out for a walk. All in all, I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Robeson

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Pouch is very well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a dog training class I was attending. Was so convenient to wear and have the dog treats all together. In the front, I put 2 or 3 doggie poop bags so I'll have them when needed. Instead of carrying around a roll of 50 of them. Very good quality and snaps together on top when you're not using it. Just keep it out of your dogs reach.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Not the best pouch I've had for training but still is pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the best pouch I've had for training but still is pretty great. The way the pouch stays open allows for really quick access but this also means soft treats will go stale so you should only full the pouch when in use and then return unused treats to a sealed bag. The velcro section seems pointless because the velcro makes it time consuming to reach high value treats in there so you just end up keeping them with the regular treats anyway. If they'd just remove the velcro it'd be better honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Broke on me, even with proper care
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this one to work out. It seemed like such a great idea. But unfortunately, after about 3 months of consistent use, the hinges broke. I had even done has others suggested, and greased the hinges every so often with some vegetable oil. Usually about once a week. But the hinges still broke. It still functioned as a bag just fine, but it didn't close anymore, so I stopped using it. It was nice while it lasted though. While I was using it, the one thing I didn't like was the front pocket. It's narrow and practically useless as a pocket. Spend the extra $10 and get the
customer_reviews.author: CJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: At least my kids can't open it and eat it hahaha
customer_reviews.text: Damn is this thing tough to open. It's fine for me. My wife won't have any of that though hahaha. Kids got at it and started crying saying they wanted to eat what's inside and made me laugh cause they can't open it! The wife just huffed and walked away. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great treat bag on the go
customer_reviews.text: Great treat bag on the go. i love how it snaps shuts when you need to close it. Our other dog is a little smarty pants and likes to get into treat bags. SHES RIPPED ABOUT 3 ALREADY but with this, she actually tried to get into it and was not as successful as she thought. Material is really strong that she didn't bite into it. i would highly recommend this and will buy again if i need to replace the one we have.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Pelayo

customer_reviews.title: DECENT BAG
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago for my son. Liked it so well I decided to buy myself one to use for treats while training the gran puppy. Easy accesses for the treats is really nice and I also like the heavy duty belt and clip to hold it in place. It also has a compartment where I can stash my smart phone and hook my keys while on walks at the park. Worth a look if you need a decent treat bag.
customer_reviews.author: savy shopper

customer_reviews.title: It was good while lasted
customer_reviews.text: This pouch lasted me seven months. As you can see on my pictures, the hinge broke off one day. I did use regularly on our walks and in obedience classes. Once it's broken, every time I bent over, treats were freely falling out of the pouch. It served the purpose but I'm looking for something else now; maybe, more stylish one ;)
customer_reviews.author: FairOrNot

customer_reviews.title: Mostly a great treat bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size, depth and ease of use of this treat bag. My only complaint is that one of the hinge pins fell out in the first month or use. This causes the bag to gape open a little instead of snapping tightly shut. This may be an anomaly as I know other people who have purchased this bag and had no issues with the bags function.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bates

customer_reviews.title: Decent pouch for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the functionality of this pouch, as you can keep it snapped open for easy treat access, or close it if needed. I wish the belt and clip hardware were better quality, as the pouch and clasp seem to be very sturdy. I would assume the belt (thin woven nylon) and clip (hard plastic) will be the first things to wear out, but I've not had any issues thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool for a great price. It has hinges to snap open or closed, a strap to wear like a belt, or a clip to just clip onto your pants, belt, even pocket. I used to just carry a few years in my pocket when working with my dog, but that was ruining my pockets and I would run out of treats fast. It's durable, too. I highly suggest buying this if you're working with your pup our dog on training.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: heavy, bulky, not easy access.
customer_reviews.text: this product is very heavy and bulky. the clip on the inside is metal which makes it heavy. also, you can't tell in the pictures, but the inside of the opening has a metal frame which helps it click open and snap shut. great in theory. aside from adding to the weight, when the pouch is open, and you are walking, it bounces around off your hip. when it is closed, the metal hinge makes it hard to access treats easily with one hand. i tried to wear this on my workout shorts and the pouch weight pulled my shorts even with very few treats in it. overall it just isn't at all what i hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Pressly

customer_reviews.title: Well made but very hard to open
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for training so I need to get in & out quickly and w/out my pup being able to notice (ie no noise from velcro, no rapid movements, no struggling to access, etc). It's very well made and love the sturdy clip & belt BUT it's far from easy to get into with one hand. :(
customer_reviews.author: k9alison

customer_reviews.title: This pouch is a much better option. The different pockets within the pouch make ...
customer_reviews.text: For the first few weeks of training I had pockets full of kibble and treats for our training times. This pouch is a much better option. The different pockets within the pouch make it easy to separate treats if you desire. For us, we keep the higher value meat treats in a different area when we are working on things like "drop it" and "leave it." It makes it very simple to offer the less exciting dry kibble/treat mix as the initial offering then reward with the more alluring treat. The waist band has a lot of range which makes it great for human puppy parents of all sizes. I would absolutely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse & Flanny

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat Pouch for Training!
customer_reviews.text: This pouch was recommended by our dog trainer. It is nice because you have different pockets inside to separate low value and high value treats when training. I like that you can move it around on the belt if your puppy is getting too nosey about the treats. It says you can put your phone in the outside pocket, but my Samsung does not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sally W.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use for training!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 75 pound lab. She can easily put her head in most pouches to help herself to treats. This one is easy to open, but snaps back closed with a simple touch to keep her out. It holds a ton of treats and has room for my hone and keys.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Cheney

customer_reviews.title: I love these training treat pouches and purchased a few for ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these training treat pouches and purchased a few for my dog training business. They close well holding the dog's food in place especially when you have to bend over to work with smaller breeds. There is a front pocket as well perfect for holding poop bags or in my case, business cards. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Minelva Concepcion

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because every time I opened the baggie I was using the entire park of dogs came running! I am trying to train one of my dogs, so this pouch is a MUCH better option. Plus there is a bit of room for poop-bags, so my jacket pockets won't be filled with them anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Constance, Berkeley CA

customer_reviews.title: Clip snapped
customer_reviews.text: I had this item for 2 weeks & the clip broke when I bent over to pick up dog poo. I had on a tshirt & leggings. So, I wasn't wearing anything heavy to have the clip break the way it did. Other, than it was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Villa

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, but could be improved upon.
customer_reviews.text: Convenient little pouch. The belt and belt clip are handy, but haven't found the little straps on the front to be very useful. Also, the main compartment likes to stay open when opened, but also likes to stay shut when closed so adding a little tab to grip to pull it open would be nice so you don't have to look down to see the exact spot where you have to slip your thumb into to open it.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was such a great buy. I used to have treats in my pockets with and without ziploc bags. Now with this, it makes it so much easier to train and reward my German Shepherd. I've only had this a few days, so far it is working as it should. The pouch stays open when you need it to and snaps closed very easily. Every dog owner should have this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog trainer recommended!
customer_reviews.text: As a dog trainer, I almost always have a treat bag somewhere on me. I've had a variety of different kinds, and these ones are consistently the best and easiest to use. The hinge on one broke after about 6 months of heavy daily use, but I've had 2 other bags going since then and haven't had any issues. When clients ask for treat bags, this is always the one I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: It has loops and pouches that I can't possibly imagine even needing but I'm glad they're there if I ever do
customer_reviews.text: This pouch is really fancy, it has some kind of clippy device built into the edge so you can pop it open during training, you don't have to fiddle with opening it over and over. It has loops and pouches that I can't possibly imagine even needing but I'm glad they're there if I ever do. It's also rather large, so it holds a good amount of treats for the session and fits my 36" inch waist with no problem. My dog gets super excited the minute she sees it, but this rating is about the actual pouch, not whether my dog likes eating treats or not (that would be a permanent five star situation, LOL).
customer_reviews.author: Mikester

customer_reviews.title: The perfect pouch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I started agility training my dog. My instructor wanted me to use a clicker, which meant giving Bilbeau a treat every time I clicked it. I needed a way to carry the treats so I bought this pouch. I have the clicker attached to the side lanyard, poop bags in the front, along with my phone, and even carry his leash in there when we're working. I can keep my hands free and yet grab a bit of treat whenever I need to. It is light weight and adjustable around the waist. I really love this pouch. I'd also recommend it for training to heel or leash train. It just keeps everything handy.
customer_reviews.author: VaRN

customer_reviews.title: I love that the top pocket stays open so it’s easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was a life saver for training my dog! I love that the top pocket stays open so it’s easy to grab treats while training and also has a clip on the side for my clicker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, but with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this treat bag at first - it's sturdier than the previous type I owned, which Amazon also sells (the Guardian Gear bag), but in less than 3 weeks, the hinge broke & now won't stay open. The good: Very sturdy Large capacity Small pocket in front, where I keep my cell phone The bad: Hinge broke very quickly The pocket is divided, but it's hard to access one side vs. the other (the Guardian Gear does a better job at separating treats) Just too bulky, at roughly 6.25 x 7.5 inches At least the Guardian Gear lasted months, through many washings, before it needed replacing.
customer_reviews.author: NortheastGal

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag, we got the smaller size which is perfect. It still holds all the treats for two dogs on long walks without feeling bulky. The clasp is sometimes hard to open with one hand. A tab or something would really help
customer_reviews.author: Mindy T.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size without being bulky. Roomy I carry about two cups of treats, poop bags , collapsible small water dish, cell phone and clip my keys on it hook. All what I need for training class or a walk around the neighborhood. The choice of using the detachable belt ot just clipping the pouch on is great. We use it both ways. The stay open section is great for training and repeat quick treat rewarding. Sturdy and good quality, is holding up like new after months of heavy use daily.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Cooker

customer_reviews.title: This is efficient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is efficient and easy to use. It has the ability to stay open for easy access to treats. I like that it has a pocket that I can put clickers in as well so everything can stay in one place. I’ve only had it for a couple weeks so I can’t speak as to it’s durability. But so far it’s working nicely for us.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Useful and great price
customer_reviews.text: I use the inside pocket for keys, phone and credit card. I use the outer pocket to hold my snack-size ziplock bag full of small training treats. I wouldn’t put treats in it. Gross! They need to be in a baggie or it will get treat crumbs all in it, stink and just be yuck!!! Come on people! Why have a smelly bag?
customer_reviews.author: Stefani Linn

customer_reviews.title: Love the hinge closure so my horse can’t stick his ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to clicker train my horse. Love the hinge closure so my horse can’t stick his nose in it when I first started and nice for transporting so the treats do not fall out. The strap is adjustable which is nice for summer and winter clothing.
customer_reviews.author: bri72isb

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat Bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I put their treats in this and reward them while I am training them. I have it hang around the back with it open for easy retrieval. The only time it gets to be a problem is when they learn that is where it is located and one of my three dogs sneaks around to my back and helps themselves while I am training another in front of me. So many times before I got this, I would forget to take treats along, or I didn't have pockets. I also put my cell phone in it and hang the poop bags off the side hoop, it works great. I can even put our fold up Frisbee in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Miller

customer_reviews.title: Stays open for ready access to rewards for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has a clamshell opening, i.e. it has hinges which snap into an open position so you can access dog treats easily when you need them but can snap it shut when you are in the car and don't want treats rolling around on the seat or floor. It is a fair-sized opening so you can get tothe treats readily. It also has the clip to hold your keys and I use it to hold my Clik-R trainer when I am not using it. I also use the strap in front to clip on a pet poo-bag dispenser so I always am ready to clean up after my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Obenour

customer_reviews.title: Great Product But Not for Those with Upper Mobility Disabilities
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall. I gave it four stars only because it’s difficult to open and close if you have a disability that limits you to the use of one hand. I often spill the treats everywhere when I open it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hardee

customer_reviews.title: Love the size!
customer_reviews.text: It was easier to get the treats out with the slightly smaller treat bag size. The only thing that would improve it is if the pull tab to open the pouch was larger and then easier to grab. When training, timing is everything and you don’t want to be fumbling with opening the pouch for your pup’s reward.
customer_reviews.author: Halloween Kid

product_meta.title: PetSafe Treat Pouch Sport- Durable, Convenient Dog Training Accessory
product_meta.description:
Size:Standard| Color:BlackThe PetSafe Treat Pouch Sport is the perfect accessory for everything from intense training sessions to trips to the dog park with your new puppy. Divided pockets that stay open make training with multiple treats a cinch. Multiple clips and loops let you attach your clicker, remote trainer or any other training tool.

AMAZON.COM



PETSAFE TREAT POUCH SPORT
The Treat Pouch Sport is the perfect accessory for training sessions and trips to the dog park. Divided pockets that stay open make training with multiple treats a cinch. Multiple clips and loops let you attach your clicker, remote trainer, or any other training tool. The versatile pouch also features a front pocket for your keys, phone, etc. With its handy pockets and clips and the durable, waterproof, stain-resistant material, you’ll love having this handy training tool anywhere you and your dog go.


FEATURES
 * Hinge stays fully open and closes with a touch
 * Divided inner pocket to separate treats
 * Front storage pocket has easy-open flap for phone, bags, etc.
 * Daisy chain elastic loops for securing Lickety Stik, SprayShield, etc.
 * Carabineer for attaching Clik-R, keys, whistle, etc.
 * Belt clip and detachable/adjustable belt
 * Machine washable, cold cycle
 * Available in 3 colors: black, red, and blue 



Available in black, red, and blue
feature_bullets: SIZE INFORMATION: Standard Sport size measures 7.75 inch wide by 6.25 inch tall; front pocket measures 7.75 inch wide by 4.5 inch tall; included belt is adjustable to 48 inch length
EXPERIENCE: PetSafe has been an industry leading U.S. manufacturer of pet behavior, containment and lifestyle products since 1991, helping millions of people and pets each year

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
